entries.meaning: (US) A television program shown after its initial presentation — particularly many weeks after its initial presentation; a repeat.
examples: I'm not a fan of the new Simpsons episodes, but the old reruns have me in stitches, although I've seen them countless times.

entries.meaning: (publishing) Another printing run (impression; batch of copies of a given edition) of a book, cartoon, etc.
(politics) A political candidate who holds the same political agenda or doctrine as a past or incumbent holder of a given political office.
(computing) A second or subsequent run of a program.
examples: Each rerun of the algorithm takes several minutes.

verbs.description: rerun (third-person singular simple present reruns, present participle rerunning, simple past reran, past participle rerun)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To run (a previously broadcast television program) again.
examples: They're still rerunning The Flintstones on this channel.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To run (a race or other contest) again.

examples: Restart the computer and rerun the installation.
